top_priorities.suggestion: Try to keep your stance about 45 degrees open to have better balance and.
top_priorities.description: The openness angle of the player's stance before swinging.
How far your dominant wrist is in front of your non-dominant hip when you hit the ball. The goal is to hit the ball in front of the non-dominant hip, but not too much in front.
top_priorities.observation: Your right wrist is just above your left hip
top_priorities.suggestion: Try getting your right wrist in front of your left hip.

strengths.suggestion: Almost there! Try to keep your body moving straight forward, following the direction of your swing.
strengths.description: Which direction your body is moving when you hit the ball. You want your body to move straight forward, following the direction of the swing (dominant wrist) and net.
strengths.observation: Your body is leaning mostly forward and slightly to one side.

wrist_speed.observation: Your wrist speed is 3.5 km/h or 2.2 mph.
wrist_speed.description: The speed of the dominant wrist at ball hit.

kinetic_chain.description: The timing and sequencing of peak speeds of the hip, shoulder, and wrist during the load to hit phase of the pickleball forehand drive.
kinetic_chain.suggestion: Your shoulder rotation occurs before your hip rotation and wrist speed peak together. Try initiating your hip rotation first, then shoulder rotation, and finally wrist speed for maximum power transfer.
kinetic_chain.observation: Your hip rotation and wrist speed peaks at the same time, after your shoulder rotation.

all_features.suggestion: Try to widen your stance to be more stable and powerful.
all_features.observation: Your leg width is 5 cm narrower than your shoulder width.
all_features.description: How wide your stance is compared to your shoulder width before swinging (load position).
The rotation of the player during the backswing. The goal is to rotate your shoulders about 45 degrees more than the hips.
all_features.observation: You have rotated your shoulders -89 degrees compared to your hips.
all_features.suggestion: Try to rotate your shoulders about 45 degrees more than your hips.

all_features.description: How much you bend your knees before swinging (load position).
all_features.suggestion: Good knee bend, try going lower to load more power.
Try to keep your stance about 45 degrees open to have better balance and.
all_features.description: The openness angle of the player's stance before swinging.

all_features.suggestion: Try bending your knees a bit so that you don't hit too far below your hip.
all_features.observation: Your right wrist is just about the height of your left hip.
all_features.description: How high up your wrist is compared to your hip-height when you hit the ball.

all_features.suggestion: Almost there! Try to keep your body moving straight forward, following the direction of your swing.
all_features.description: Which direction your body is moving when you hit the ball. You want your body to move straight forward, following the direction of the swing (dominant wrist) and net.
all_features.observation: Your body is leaning mostly forward and slightly to one side.

all_features.description: How far your dominant wrist is in front of your non-dominant hip when you hit the ball. The goal is to hit the ball in front of the non-dominant hip, but not too much in front.
all_features.observation: Your right wrist is just above your left hip
all_features.suggestion: Try getting your right wrist in front of your left hip.
Try to widen your legs to be more stable and powerful.
all_features.observation: Your leg width is -5 cm narrower than your shoulder width.
all_features.description: How wide your leg stance is compared to your shoulder width when you hit the ball.

all_features.suggestion: Try swinging more upwards to add more spoin and control.
all_features.description: How much your swing is moving up or down when you hit the ball.
all_features.observation: Your swing is moving 3 degrees up.
